messages.title: A better plan. A better future.
messages.content: Ed Balls outlines Labour's plan to deal with the deficit, balance the books, and create a strong economic foundation.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Balance the books and cut the deficit every year. No manifesto commitments will require extra borrowing.
People who come here won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years, saving in the benefits system.
20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, and cancer tests guaranteed within a week.
Implement a mansion tax on properties over £2 million and close tax loopholes. Introduce a levy on tobacco firms.

issues.economy: Plans to cut the deficit every year without additional borrowing, benefiting from a strong economic foundation.
issues.education: Sensible spending cuts while protecting health and education services.
issues.health: Promise of 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 GPs, with cancer tests delivered within a week.
issues.immigration: Newcomers will not be eligible for benefits for at least two years.
issues.socialWelfare: Savings in the benefits system through changed eligibility for immigrants and sensible spending cuts.

housing.content: Introducing a mansion tax for properties over £2 million.

leaflet.personalStatement: We have a better plan for our country based on a simple truth: Britain only succeeds when working people succeed.

images.caption: Ed Balls' campaign leaflet outlining Labour's plan for a better future.
